alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 11:52AM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 to 30 degrees below zero with the coldest readings in Union County. * WHERE...Far Northeast Highlands, Harding County, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass, and Union County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill temperatures will rise some this afternoon, then fall again tonight as the ambient air temperature cools and wind speeds gradually weaken.
info.instruction: Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors and ensure their drinking water does not freeze.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
